data.title: 2011) – Find a Grave Gedenkstätte
data.meta_description: Ruth Annette Keen, of Frisco, TX passed away peacefully on 6/20/2011.  She was born 5/16/1925 in Kansas City, KS, to Herbert V. Beatty and Anna M. Rollheiser.  She attended Mt. St. Scholastica College in Atchison, KS and later Univ. of MA, Boston. She was: an Avon Lady and a Welcome Wagon representative in Gladstone,...
data.text:
Ruth Annette Keen, of Frisco, TX passed away peacefully on 6/20/2011. She was born 5/16/1925 in Kansas City, KS, to Herbert V. Beatty and Anna M. Rollheiser.

She attended Mt. St. Scholastica College in Atchison, KS and later Univ. of MA, Boston. She was: an Avon Lady and a Welcome Wagon representative in Gladstone, MO; an activity director for elderly care in Norwood, MA; president of the PTA at Norwood High School; and real estate broker in Naperville, IL

Always seeking to put her faith into action, she volunteered at a mental health facility in Norwood, MA, was a foster mother to two children, volunteered at Special Olympics in Hot Springs, AR and founded the Ladies of the Sacred Heart of Jesus of Hot Springs Village which has grown to 325 members now assisting people in need.

She was the first President of Kiwanitas in Hot Springs Village, AR. She hosted a foreign exchange student from Italy, another from France and a business trainee from Sweden. She was an avid bowler, golfer, card player and tennis player.

A devout Roman Catholic, she was a member of St. Francis of Assisi Church. She was a devoted Navy wife who is described by her husband as being the closest thing on earth to an angel. Our Lord has blessed a true keeper of His kingdom.

Married November 16, 1944 in Kansas City, MO, she is survived by: her husband of 66 yrs, Cdr. Harold Claus Keen, USN Ret. of Frisco, TX., brother Herb Beatty of Garden City, MO, brother Bill Beatty (Mary) and sister Anna Marie Bowlen of Shawnee, KS, sons Harold Frederick Keen (Terry) of Aubrey, TX and William Christopher Keen (Lucinda) of Frisco, TX, daughter Martha Louise Neighbors (Dan)of Birmingham, AL, nine grandchildren and four great grandchildren.

She was preceded in death by brothers Charles Beatty and Richard Beatty, son Gerald Keen and daughter Carol Anne Keen.

Visitation 6 to 8 pm Friday 6/24 at Dalton and Son Funeral Home, 1550 North Stemmons Fwy, Lewisville, TX. Funeral Services 10 am Sat at Holy Cross Church, 7000 Morning Star Dr., The Colony, TX. See daltonandson.com. Interment will be at the National Cemetery in Fort Worth. Family requests any desired remembrances be made to St. Jude's Children's hospital as Ruth felt a special closeness to St. Jude.

Dallas Morning News, 6/23/2011
